result.execSummary:
The defendant Deon P Downs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Contact Racine Vocational Ministry to address substance abuse and cognitive thinking issues.  No contct with gangs or gang members.  Not to possess or use any firearms.  Comply with any Family Court orders.  No driving without valid driver's license.  Take steps to obtain driver's license.  No contact with J.B. or Z.F.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Deon P Downs in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft has a pending felony file in case 15CF1280.
Deft indicates he was unaware of the court date in these matters.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT.
State is requesting that bond be modified to $50-$100 additional cash on each case.
Defense requests that the bond remain as set for reasons stated on the record.
BTC: 15CM1457 bond will remain as set. On Case 15CM1459 bond will be modified to $100 cash with a $200 signature bond. Deft has until 4:30 today 3-24-16 to post the bond, failure to post bond, deft must report to RCJ.
  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***3-24-16 DEFT HAS UNTIL 4:30 PM TODAY TO POST BOND. FAILURE TO POST, DEFT MUST REPORT TO THE RCJ.***  ***ALSO $200.00 SIGNATURE BOND***  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No violent contact with the victim, LDC (person, property, residence or family). Defendant must be in his home by 5:00PM each day of the week.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
